Description: Terracotta figure in form of male head. A grotesque male head, probably made as an entity, with no attached body, perhaps an appliqué. It has a large nose and a slightly opened mouth, but is in very bad condition, the surface lost from above the nose, including much of both eyes; the ears are also largely gone. The back is slightly concave. Pressed into a one-piece mould. Micaceous brown Nile silt; faint traces of a white dressing.
Curator's comments: BM Terracotta IV Comparanda. Near: Petrie Museum c47857, from Memphis; Pons Mellado 1998: 113, no. 1981/1/208.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3588)
